alert.note: Alert for Motherlode; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 13 at 7:33PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Sacramento, northeastern San Joaquin, north central Stanislaus, west central Calaveras and southwestern Amador Counties through 830 PM PDT... At 732 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Ione to near Waterloo. Movement was northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Ione, Campo Seco, Waterloo, Rancho Seco Park, Camanche Reservoir, Victor, Wallace, Drytown, Forest Home, Camanche Village, Rancho Calaveras, Valley Springs, Sutter Creek, Amador City, Lockeford, Carbondale, Linden and Morada. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Motherlode; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley
